item.title: Building 'pwd' Under 1 Minute In Swift
item.description:
I guess I‚Äôm starting a series of minute-long videos. In this first video, I built pwd out of getcwd. The code turned out shorter than I imagined (1 line). Which is a good demonstration of Swift‚Äôs great C-interop capability.

Some details are lost in this video, however. For example, the POSIX standard actually says getcwd‚Äôs 2nd argument being 0 is undefined. Luckily, both macOS and Linux define it the way we want (allocate as much memory as needed). Swift‚Äôs handling of char * aka UnsafeMutablePointer<CChar> in context of a var array is also very cool.

item.title: Contributing To Open-Source Swift
item.description:
I discover, report, fix and merge a bug in the open-source Foundation project. And why, yes, on YouTube.

  • Pull request: https://github.com/apple/swift-corelibs-foundation/pull/1376
  • SR-6647: https://bugs.swift.org/browse/SR-6647

item.title: BitArray The Final Act
item.description:
Alas, there‚Äôs the 3rd and last video about BitArray, originated on my spark of inspiration on a Caltrain ride home. This makes my first YouTube playlist as well, even tho the first 2 videos were planned to be completely separate.

We added more standard library functionalities to BitArray (ExpressibleByArrayLiteral, CustomStringConvertible, Equatable, etc). Then, we added documentation and other open-source things left undone from ‚Äúepisode 2‚Äù.

item.title: Making An Open-Source Swift Project
item.description:
This video shows what it takes to open source a Swift project. Starting from some code in a playground, I created a framework that supports distribution via Swift Package Manager, CocoaPods, Xcode project and Carthage. The framework can be used across iOS, macOS, watchOS, tvOS and Linux. In addition, we also added SwiftLint to the project, added a Makefile, put everything on GitHub and set up continuous integration via Travis. README, COC, LICENSE and CHANGELOG are stubbed in as well.

This is not at all a comprehensive list of things a good Open Source project should have. We are still missing the version tag, documentation generation, automatic Carthage binary generation, test coverage‚Ä¶

Anyways, here‚Äôs some stuff mentioned in the video:

  • Sample project from the video: https://github.com/dduan/BitArray
  • Video of me writing the code in this project: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-k_jrIoD56k
  • Swift Package Manager: https://swift.org/package-manager/
  • CocoaPods: https://cocoapods.org
  • Carthage: https://github.com/Carthage/Carthage
  • Xcconfigs for universal framework: https://github.com/mrackwitz/xcconfigs
  • SwiftLint: https://github.com/realm/SwiftLint
  • Travis CI: https://travis-ci.org

item.title: Let's Build A BitArray In Swift
item.description:
In this video, I build a space-efficient BitArray that confirms to RandomAccessCollection in Swift in a playground. It involves some basic (but neat!) bitwise manipulation tricks.

I guess I‚Äôm a YouTuber now. You can subscribe to my channel üòõ.
